title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 30 May 2012 - XWiki
content:
06:57 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
06:57 <ssavi> sdumitriu:  
06:57 <@sdumitriu> Hi ssavi  
06:58 <ssavi> Should I assign my name to the bug before giving pull request?  
06:59 <ssavi> Can you please tell me what the procedure is?  
07:01 <@sdumitriu> Well, normally you should assign an issue to yourself when you start working on it  
07:01 <@sdumitriu> But given that you're not a committer, you can just leave it unassigned  
07:02 <@sdumitriu> The purpose of the "Assignee" field is twofold:  
07:02 <@sdumitriu> - let others know that someone is already working on that issue, so that effort is not waisted by parallel development  
07:02 <@sdumitriu> - when closing an issue, to let others know who closed that issue, so that they know whom to ask about it  
07:04 <ssavi> sdumitriu: Oh.. .k So,I'll just leave a mail after the pull request?  
07:05 <@sdumitriu> No need for that either, since committers already get an email automatically with the pull request  
07:05 <ssavi> Thanks a lot sergiu :)  
07:05 <@sdumitriu> You're welcome  
07:05 <@sdumitriu> So, how are you doing so far? Enjoying GSoC and XWiki?  
07:12 <ssavi> Learning a lot. Little hectic but enjoying..  
07:12 <ssavi> took a while to get comfortable with things.  
07:13 <ssavi> By the sergiu, The API list is growing too big. It is so cluttered in the design page.  
07:13 <ssavi> So thought of generating javadocs as I got access to my gihub contrib today  
07:18 <@sdumitriu> Yep, nothing's better than code itself  
07:19 <ssavi> sdumitriu: I went through XWiki architecture the other day.  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Architecture . Do you any links for the detailed documentation of this? By the way XWiki has moved completely to component based?  
07:20 <ssavi> Do you have you any links for the detailed documentation of this \*  
07:20 <@sdumitriu> Hm, the Architecture page is getting deprecated...  
07:20 <@sdumitriu> Not everything is a component yet, but we're moving towards that goal  
07:21 <@sdumitriu> The rule is that no new code should be non-component  
07:21 <@sdumitriu> Detailed documentation, unfortunately no  
07:32 <ssavi> sdumitriu: If it doesn't take much of your time, I'm inquisitive to know why XWiki's architecture is moved from plug in based architecture to component based  
07:36 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:38 <ssavi> has left #xwiki  
07:40 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
07:50 <ssavi> sdumitriu: If I'm not taking much of your time, could you please tell me why XWiki moved from plugin based to component based architecture?  
07:50 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
07:51 <@sdumitriu> Basically, XWiki "plugins" had very limited power  
07:51 <@sdumitriu> A component is a new interface that can do any thing it wants  
07:52 <@sdumitriu> A plugin had to implement an interface that contained just a few methods  
07:52 <@sdumitriu> And most of them were tied to the old rendering engine (Radeox) and old syntax (xwiki/1.0)  
07:53 <@sdumitriu> So it was a big core with a few spikes plugged into it  
07:53 <@sdumitriu> Now components form a free-form graph, connecting between each other as they need  
07:58 <ssavi> sdumitriu: I understand to some extent. When I start exploring more, I think i'll get a better hang of XWiki's architecture. Thanks a lot sergiu.  
08:13 <ssavi> has left #xwiki  
08:24 <tekzilla> has quit

10:27 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <CIA-87> Vincent Massol master \* re7dac43 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/e7dac434c9a993d4796f7cb94583e8f04e780965 / (3 files in 3 dirs): XCOMMONS-182: Environment Configuration should only be taken from the xwiki properties file - http://git.io/n3ivSw  
10:38 <CIA-87> Vincent Massol master \* r454d433 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/454d4338558c892bffb2c833d5c2564b02718b7a / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/hibernate/DefaultHibernateSessionFactory.java : XWIKI-7864: Allow the Hibernate connection URL configuration to use the Environment Permanent Directory property - http://git.io/FVqGhw

11:17 <Inge-\_> Hi.

11:29 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki

12:13 <Inge> is now known as <Inge->  
12:16 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:14 <vmassol> has quit  
13:31 <mflorea> has quit  
13:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:59 <evalica> has quit  
14:00 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <+sburjan> Hello. Does anyone have some time to review my pull request about exclude failing tests on IE9 ? https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/pull/23  
14:47 <+sburjan> there is something odd at the lastest snapshot on trunk, it seems XE is not included, it's like an empty platform only  
14:52 <vmassol> we need to review the build since I've noticed lots of jenkins errors sent by mail  
14:53 <vmassol> cjd: hi, what's the status re the 4.1M2 release?  
14:53 <vmassol> when do we start the release?  
14:53 <vmassol> are we all ready?  
14:53 <+sburjan> odd, I never saw such a build .. with platform only  
14:53 <@cjd> I'm ready when the developers are  
14:53 <vmassol> so never  
14:53 <vmassol> :)  
14:53 <@cjd> well...  
14:54 <vmassol> do you want me to play the role of RM?  
14:54 <@cjd> Maybe I'm not understanding it properly?  
14:54 <vmassol> (ie ask the question)  
14:54 <vmassol> again  
14:54 <vmassol> it's about gathering everyone around the planned release date  
14:54 <@cjd> Should I go around and bust people to get their stuff in order?  
14:54 <vmassol> yep  
14:55 <vmassol> you could do this:  
14:55 <vmassol> - start by asking here to people online whether they are ready and if not when, mentioning the planned release date  
14:55 <vmassol> - then send a mail on the list saying that you're going to cut the release at that date  
14:55 <vmassol> people who have important stuff to do on 4.1:  
14:56 <vmassol> http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
14:56 <vmassol> namely: marius/thomas for EM, jeanvincent for Hiding tehc content, Sergiu for app generation module  
14:57 <@cjd> Well I can send mail to the list saying I'll release tomorrow if nobody objects, or perhaps I should say friday so people have longer to object?  
14:57 <vmassol> you can do that too  
14:57 <vmassol> you can say tomorrow since we're already late  
14:57 <@cjd> I don't like nagging people directly  
14:57 <vmassol> it's about asking  
14:58 <vmassol> it's not really directly  
14:58 <vmassol> we're all here  
14:58 <vmassol> for example:  
14:58 <vmassol> mflorea/tmortagne: are you done for 4.1M2 on EM? Is it ok to release tomorrow?  
14:59 <+mflorea> yes, I'm working for RC1 now  
14:59 <vmassol> (taking into account that the planned release date was 28th of May so we're already late)  
14:59 <vmassol> mflorea: ok thanks  
14:59 <vmassol> tmortagne is having lunch; he'll be back soon  
14:59 <@cjd> there seem to be a few problems with this design (or maybe it's problems with me since I'm the only one who has trouble)..  I see #1 the RM can't release until everyone is ok, #2 lots of commits come in at the last minute making it wowefully unstable when the release comes..  
15:00 <vmassol> cjd: yep  
15:00 <vmassol> #1 is not fully correct  
15:00 <vmassol> in order for the RM to respect the release date  
15:01 <@cjd> so the date is basicly just a number..  
15:01 <vmassol> he needs to ask devs beforehand  
15:01 <vmassol> here's the situation  
15:01 <vmassol> we have a roadmap  
15:01 <vmassol> and a date  
15:01 <vmassol> our goal is to do the max defined in the roadmap for the date  
15:01 <vmassol> if someone requires one more day to have his important stuff in the release  
15:02 <vmassol> I would find it a pity to not include his stuff for 1 day  
15:02 <vmassol> now if that same dev says he needs 1 week more  
15:02 <@cjd> IMO that's not true because committing just before release damages stability.  
15:02 <vmassol> then that's too much and he shoudl wait for the next release  
15:02 <+tmortagne> cjd/vmassol: I don't work on anything blocker for M2  
15:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok thanks  
15:02 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
15:02 <vmassol> jvdrean: ping  
15:03 <+tmortagne> (working on generic 3-ways merge before merging the diff module)  
15:03 <vmassol> cjd: that's why we have milestones and RCs  
15:03 <vmassol> (and automated tests)  
15:03 <+sburjan> and me :)  
15:03 <vmassol> cjd: but if you want me to say that's it's bad practice to commit on the last day then yes it definitely is  
15:04 <+sburjan> it's also to test when others still commit. glad we';; lahve stagning for RC's  
15:04 <vmassol> yes and sburjan too  
15:04 <vmassol> :)  
15:05 <+sburjan> I test today, and tomorrow just before you start the release someone commits something that is a blocker, and I won't be able to get it on time :)  
15:05 <@cjd> If we do things which are bad practice, that's ok IMO, everyone has flaws. If we document the way things really work then we can work on improving the process.. As long as we are honest and don't smooth over the rough edges in documenting it.  
15:05 <vmassol> cjd: I'm all for testing a different strategy but please propose that strategy on the list first and let's all agreee before changing in mid step  
15:06 <vmassol> the current strategy is far from perfect  
15:06 <@cjd> ok, my problem has been that I think I have has a "rose colored glasses" view of how the release process works.. that's all.  
15:06 <vmassol> it's the best we have ATM  
15:06 <vmassol> hehe :)  
15:06 <vmassol> it's an interest'ing topic  
15:07 <+mflorea> vmassol: btw, when I checked this morning, the CI failures were pointing to your commit  
15:07 <vmassol> mflorea: I fixed them this morning AFAIK,  
15:07 <vmassol> checking  
15:07 <@cjd> My thinking had been that you pick a time when nobody is committing and everything is nice and stable somewhere on or after the announced date and you release, giving the best possible version.  
15:07 <+mflorea> vmassol: ok, all tests are still failing  
15:08 <vmassol> checking now  
15:09 <@cjd> My ammended thinking is you announce your intent to release and then ask if anyone has anything to commit, if delay is necessary then you delay, then after everyone is satisfied that you have committed you start trying to improve the stability of the build until the tests are all either fixed or understood.  
15:09 <@cjd> Is this accurate?  
15:09 <+jvdrean> vmassol, cjd: pong, nothing to commit on my side except a small fix  
15:10 <@cjd> So there is a "slip under the door" period, followed by a stabilizing period, then the release.  
15:10 <@cjd> And it makes sense that nobody can slip anything under the door during the stabilization period, otherwise it would be endless.  
15:10 <+mflorea> cjd: I believe we have milestone and rc for that  
15:11 <+mflorea> I don't say the release shouldn't be stable, but we shouldn't spend 1 week to stabilize a milestone  
15:12 <@cjd> by stabilization I mean broken tests which have not been investigated/understood  
15:13 <@cjd> whatever we really do I would like to put down in some notes just so poor saps like me don't come along thinking this is easy ;)  
15:14 <+mflorea> :) we should definitely look more often at the state of CI (check it a few times per day)  
15:14 <+mflorea> otherwise you commit and then with 1 day before the release you release tests are failing on CI because of your commits  
15:16 <@cjd> well.. ideally commits would trickle in over time and releases would be purely timeboxed but I'm not interested in changing the approach but rather understanding it.  
15:16 <vmassol> on my side I'm also ready  
15:16 <@cjd> If in the process of understanding, we decide that change is necessary then that's step 2.  
15:16 <vmassol> so we just need sdumitriu's status....  
15:17 <@cjd> vmassol: am I right re "My ammended thinking" above?  
15:18 <vmassol> cjd: yes it's correct with the goal of slipping the less possible ofc so the RM should start "early" in this process and refuse if the devs ask for too much delay compared to the release date  
15:18 <vmassol> too much being something we debate between ourselves here  
15:18 <vmassol> s/too much/"too much"/  
15:19 <@cjd> It seems like the RM should be basicly just a bearucrat and if the community wants to hold the release for 3 weeks then the RM does as the community asks...  
15:20 <@cjd> I mean if it's agreed to on the list then it's the community's decisions..  
15:20 <vmassol> that doesn't quite work out  
15:20 <vmassol> since that means lagging a lot  
15:20 <vmassol> the RM should try to observe the planned date as much as possible  
15:20 <vmassol> ie gather eveyrone around that date  
15:20 <vmassol> ideally he shouldn't have to do this  
15:21 <vmassol> but we don't live in an ideal world...  
15:21 <@cjd> IMO we (I) need to understand exactly how it works before talking about how to improve it..  
15:21 <vmassol> all devs are focused on their dev work  
15:21 <vmassol> while the RM has the release as an objective  
15:21 <vmassol> that's the difference  
15:22 <vmassol> said harshly, the RM should consider it's his failure if the planned date is not met  
15:22 <vmassol> well let me rephrase that :)  
15:22 <vmassol> since it's not just about date  
15:22 <vmassol> it's also about content  
15:23 <vmassol> ie planned roadmap  
15:23 <@cjd> I was coming from that understanding but given any developer can hold the release, that requirement becomes a little silly  
15:23 <@cjd> but if that's how it works, lets just write it down...  
15:23 <vmassol> yes we can write it down and then improve it  
15:23 <vmassol> (after the release is done so that we don't mix the two)  
15:23 <@cjd> yeap  
15:24 <@cjd> that's my thinking, once we come to a clear understanding we can think about how to improve  
15:24 <@cjd> trying to sweep unplesentries under the carpet makes it impossible to improve  
15:28 <@cjd> mail sent re releasing early tomorrow.  
15:28 <vmassol> ok so let's fix the build till then  
15:33 <CIA-87> tmortagne feature-diff \* r977ec05 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/977ec055e43b3ddb82a231077179abc615077f28 / (4 files in 4 dirs): XCOMMONS-167: Introduce diff/merge API - http://git.io/70N\_Qg  
15:37 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle feature-diff \* rebd8a08 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/ebd8a0880e324b1b0202ad9b8469e0a21a0a22b2 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-environment/xwiki-commons-environment-servlet/src/test/java/org/xwiki/environment/internal/ServletEnvironmentTest.java : [misc.] Trying to fix test which fails on some systems. - http://git.io/iyMZLg  
15:37 <CIA-87> Vincent Massol feature-diff \* r01f44b9 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/01f44b9ca5cce7a45ee18851b6e1f0dd43ca2e8f / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-environment/xwiki-commons-environment-common/src/main/java/org/xwiki/environment/internal/DefaultEnvironmentConfiguration.java : XCOMMONS-182: Environment Configuration should only be taken from the xwiki properties file - http://git.io/DgewlA  
15:37 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle feature-diff \* r74ccf0d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/74ccf0dca0369f76afe1f65bcb389136e0ebf2a2 / (7 files in 7 dirs): XWIKI-7748: Changed to a more agreed-upon solution for temp file related exceptions. - http://git.io/Ydz6Rg  
15:37 <CIA-87> Vincent Massol feature-diff \* re7dac43 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/e7dac434c9a993d4796f7cb94583e8f04e780965 / (3 files in 3 dirs): XCOMMONS-182: Environment Configuration should only be taken from the xwiki properties file - http://git.io/n3ivSw  
15:37 <CIA-87> tmortagne feature-diff \* r1b0655e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/1b0655ead15c638e7902db815eb51d848e1f66c6 / (10 files in 9 dirs): Merge branch 'master' into feature-diff - http://git.io/vOsYPQ  
15:47 <@cjd> looks like permissions/authentication is completely broken.  
15:49 <vmassol> I'd like to commit "Add notion of "Restricted" Configuration Source to XWiki Commons" ASAP, before 4.1M2 (ie today)....  
15:49 <vmassol> if you have any opinion please shoot  
15:49 <vmassol> (I have the code ready on my computer)  
15:50 <@cjd> my opinion is that any changes which aren't strictly for stabilization are for destabilization.. but you don't need my permission :)  
15:52 <vmassol> you're right ofc. However it doesn't remove anything so there's little chance it's going to cause any trouble and I'm comitting to fixing any issue quickly :)  
15:53 <vmassol> btw my apologies for yesterday, I committed too quickly….  
15:54 <@cjd> and I appologize if I'm introducing cynicism/unfriendlyness, I'm trying to see things in the best light.  
15:57 <@cjd> XWIKI-7864: Allow the Hibernate connection URL configuration to use the Environment  
15:57 <@cjd> this will not work  
15:57 <@cjd> because if there is no configured perminant directory, it fails over to the temp directory  
15:59 <+tmortagne> master does not seems to be in very good shape, lots of failing integration tests  
15:59 <+tmortagne> is it known and in progress alrady ?  
15:59 <@cjd> I think it might be 454d4338558c892bffb2c833d5c2564b02718b7a  
16:00 <@cjd> because it doesn't seem to handle the case where there is no perminant directory configured  
16:00 <@cjd> which Environment does  
16:01 <@cjd> vmassol: do you want to revert that or mind if I do so we can see if that fixes the problem?  
16:01 <+tmortagne> well some of the errors don't seems related to that, right issues but maybe  
16:01 <+tmortagne> for example http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/1468/testReport/org.xwiki.test.escaping/TemplateTest/templates\_\_deleteuorg\_vm\_\_docname\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_testParameterEscaping/  
16:02 <vmassol> cjd: I don't understand what you mean by "because if there is no configured perminant directory, it fails over to the temp directory"  
16:03 <@cjd> if environment.perminantDirectory is not set to anything then it prints a warning and uses the temporary directory  
16:03 <vmassol> I have this ATM:  
16:03 <vmassol>             String newURL = StringUtils.replace(url, String.format("${%s}", PROPERTY\_PERMANENTDIRECTORY),  
16:03 <vmassol>                 xwikiPropertiesConfigurationSource.getProperty(PROPERTY\_PERMANENTDIRECTORY, String.class));  
16:04 <vmassol> this will return null ATM not use the temp dir  
16:04 <vmassol> ;)  
16:04 <@cjd> ok so you've handled the returning null case  
16:04 <vmassol> not really  
16:04 <@cjd> it looked like a bug when I read it  
16:04 <vmassol> I need to fix that  
16:04 <vmassol> however you're right  
16:05 <@cjd> at any rate everything is broken because you can't login  
16:05 <vmassol> I have a new local commit where I've used  
16:05 <vmassol>             String newURL = StringUtils.replace(url, String.format("${%s}", PROPERTY\_PERMANENTDIRECTORY),  
16:05 <vmassol>                 environment.getPermanentDirectory().getAbsolutePath());  
16:05 <vmassol> and indeed this uses the temp directory  
16:05 <vmassol> but I don't see how that's wrong  
16:05 <vmassol> if no perm dir is set it's normal  
16:06 <@cjd> at any rate, I think the xwikiPropertiesConfigurationSource.getProperty(PROPERTY\_PERMANENTDIRECTORY) --> null case needs to be handled.  
16:07 <vmassol> cjd: as I've said I've changed it locally  
16:07 <vmassol> I'm rebuilding eveything to test before committing  
16:07 <vmassol> I now have:  
16:07 <vmassol>       String newURL = StringUtils.replace(url, String.format("${%s}", PROPERTY\_PERMANENTDIRECTORY),  
16:07 <vmassol>                 environment.getPermanentDirectory().getAbsolutePath());  
16:09 <CIA-87> Ecaterina Moraru (Valica) master \* r7d2c257 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/7d2c257d45b55def322ff88e535bf870c1f97cf7 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.properties : XWIKI-7865: Broken translation in page history when updating a class property - http://git.io/34gqsw  
16:12 <jvelo> has quit  
16:14 <jvdrean> has quit  
16:20 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
16:27 <CIA-87> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r603330d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/603330d881a7838d50c275469b0760be0c2a952c / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/objects/classes/ListClass.java : XWIKI-7866 : List XProperties can contain invalid character when displayed in edit mode (select / radio) - http://git.io/336azw  
16:33 <silviar> has quit  
16:41 <CIA-87> tmortagne feature-extensionrequestcustomization \* r411d035 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/411d035262a779587f782b8ed0414000147bdfa8 / (8 files in 5 dirs): XCOMMONS-171: Add various customizations to install/UninstallRequest - http://git.io/fvbpvg

21:06 <vmassol> has quit  
21:12 <@cjd> rights are defined by objects which are attached to documents to to reset them you have to revert changes to the documents which have the right objects.  
21:13 <@cjd> resetting them all isn't really possible without either writing a script to try to put permissions back to "a seemingly sane state" or clearing and reimporting the wiki.
